title: Murderers who 'assassinated' man and girlfriend near Brooklyn nightclub jailed for 50 years to life
text:
Two men convicted of the execution-style murder of a couple as they sat in a car outside a nightclub in New York have been sentenced to 50 years to life in prison.

Gary Martin, 35, and Kenrick Bayliss, 37, ambushed Devon Hannibal, 27, and Christina Stubbs, 23, as they left a Brooklyn club in 2017, slaughtering the pair in a hail of bullets.

Father-of-two, Hannibal was stuck 12 times while Stubbs was hit once when the couple were gunned down in an SUV after leaving the Hall Next Door club on June 23, 2017.

The gunman emptied his 13-shot 9mm clip through the driver's side window of the red Dodge Durange, police said.

Gary Martin (above) was sentenced to 50 years to life in jail for the murder Christina Stubbs and Devon Hannibal in a car parked outside the Hall Next Door club in Brooklyn

Devon Hannibal (right), 27, was shot 12 times through the driver's side of his SUV in Brooklyn in 2017. Christina Stubbs (left), 23, was killed by a stray bullet meant for her partner

It is believed Hannibal was the intended target and Stubbs was killed by a stray bullet as she sat in the passenger's seat.

Surveillance footage from the time of the killings at around 4.40am showed a man fleeing the scene, while another captured an SUV driving away in reverse.

Cell phone records showed Bayliss tracked the victims' movements while Martin got guns for both men.

Bayliss text Martin to tell him when the victims were leaving the club, then acted as a lookout while Martin committed the shooting, prosecutors said.

Prosecutors have not disclosed a motive for the attack.

Martin and Bayliss maintained their innocence but each were convicted of two counts of second-degree murder on September 27.

Yesterday at Brooklyn Supreme Court Martin and Bayliss were handed two consecutive 25 years-to-life sentences - the harshest jail terms available.

Kenrick Bayliss (above) was said to have text his accomplice Gary Martin to let him know when their targets left the Brooklyn nightclub at around 4.40am

The Hall Next door club, also known as Linden Hall, in East New York, Brooklyn, was the scene of the double homicide in June 2017

Justice Vincent Del Giudice told a packed courtroom that the 'case shows the very worst of mankind', according to the New York Daily News.

He said: 'The intent of this court is that these individuals never be released again. This case shows the very worst of mankind.

'These two victims were hunted, they were stalked and they were assassinated. Each click of the trigger shows a person's intention. Each victim is entitled to justice.'

Brooklyn District Attorney Eric Gonzalez said the 'defendants coldly orchestrated the execution of two young people'.

In a statement he added: 'This sentencing should send a clear message that there are serious consequences for those who devastate and terrorize our communities with gun violence.'

Hannibal had children aged four and five at the time of the attack, police said.
description: Gary Martin and Kenrick Bayliss ambushed Devon Hannibal, 27, and Christina Stubbs, 23, as they left a Brooklyn nightclub in 2017, slaughtering them in a hail of bullets.
